text:
<optional title, max 6 words>

<setup: tense confrontation in a dim room>
<optional narration, ≤ 6 words>
Raskolnikov: “I was not delirious! I knew!”  

Porfiry: “Ah, but did you?”  

Raskolnikov: “You can’t accuse me!”  

---

<setup: Raskolnikov feels dizzy and anxious>
<optional narration, ≤ 6 words>
Raskolnikov: “Is it possible he’s lying?”  

Raskolnikov: “No, he can’t be!”  

Raskolnikov: “This fury... it might drive me mad!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov grapples with his guilt and mental state after being indirectly involved in a murder, leading to a struggle between his sanity and the perception of his actions.
